summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 20, 2019. The sheets are routine logs for monitoring inmates in administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, requiring staff to observe inmates at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of institutional record-keeping in place at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Standard 30-minute checks were conducted throughout the day and night for inmates held in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York dated July 20, 2019.
It details a 30-minute check protocol for inmates in continuous locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.
The logs show staff were required to observe inmates at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are signed off by watch operations lieutenants and a captain, indicating a chain of review.
This type of document represents the standard operational procedure for monitoring high-risk inmates at the facility.
